Class Game

fang2.core.FrameAdvancer

fang2.core.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
AlarmScheduler, ActionListener, WindowStateListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible, RootPaneContainer
Direct Known Subclasses:
PlayerNameInput
public class Game extends GameRedirection
The class representing a FANG video game. This is an "empty" game box. By extending it, a program gets the pretty window, the buttons, and the behavior of every FANG video game. Because the box is empty, there is no actual game contained in this class. Programmers extend Game to create their own games. The extension is usually by defining new versions of setup() and advance(double) (or advance() if you don't care about elapsed time between frames). Create and initialize game attributes in the setup() method and then update their state in the advance(double) method. In FANG, a game runs something like this (the following is not actually Java): 
 create Window,
 create Game g; 
 g.setup(); 
 while (!g.isGameOver()) { 
   draw all known Sprites 
   check for input from all input devices 
   calculate timeSinceLastCall to advance 
   g.advance(timeSinceLastCall);
 }
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Create a new Game with the default size and default background color. See DEFAULT_GAME_DIMENSIONS and DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_COLOR for definitions of the default values. The game will keep the same aspect ratio (ratio between width and height) even when resized after creation.

    • Game

      public Game(Color backgroundColor)

    • Game

      public Game(Dimension gameDimensions)
      Create a new Game with the default size and default background color. See DEFAULT_GAME_DIMENSIONS and DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_COLOR for definitions of the default values. The game will keep the same aspect ratio (ratio between width and height) even when resized after creation.
      Parameters:
      gameDimensions - initial dimensions of the game field in pixels

    • Game

      public Game(int gamePixelWidth, int gamePixelHeight)
      Create a new Game with the given size and default background color. See DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_COLOR for definitions of the default values. The game will keep the same aspect ratio (ratio between width and height) even when resized after creation.
      Parameters:
      gamePixelWidth - initial width of the game field in pixels
      gamePixelHeight - initial height of the game field in pixels

    • Game

      public Game(int gamePixelWidth, int gamePixelHeight, Color backgroundColor)
      Create a new Game with the given size and given background color. The game will keep the same aspect ratio (ratio between width and height) even when resized after creation.
      Parameters:
      gamePixelWidth - initial width of the game field in pixels
      gamePixelHeight - initial height of the game field in pixels
      backgroundColor - inital background color of the game field

    • Game

      public Game(Dimension gameDimensions, Color backgroundColor)

      gameDimensions - initial dimensions of the game field in pixels
      backgroundColor - inital background color of the game field

      public Location2D getMouse2D(int id)
      Get location for a given player. Returns the location (a point) in screen coordinates (0.0-1.0 for both x- and y-coordinates).
      Parameters:
      id - - the identifier of the player to get the mouse for
      Returns:
      the location of the mouse of the given player

    • getClick2D

      public Location2D getClick2D(int id)
      Get location for the given player's mouse when any button was clicked. Returns the location (a point) in screen coordinates (0.0-1.0 for both x- and y-coordinates) where any button was clicked.
      Parameters:
      id - - player id to get coordinate for
      Returns:
      the location of the mouse of the given player; null if the player did not click this frame

    • getClickX

      public double getClickX(int id)
      Return the x-coordinate of the given player's mouse when any button was clicked. If no button was clicked, will return the special numeric value not a number or Double.NaN.
      Parameters:
      id - player to find mouse click location for
      Returns:
      x-coordinate (in screens) where mouse was clicked (if clicked this frame); Double.NaN if no mouse click this frame

    • getClickY

      public double getClickY(int id)
      Return the y-coordinate of the given player's mouse when any button was clicked. If no button was clicked, will return the special numeric value not a number or Double.NaN.
      Parameters:
      id - player to find mouse click location for
      Returns:
      y-coordinate (in screens) where mouse was clicked (if clicked this frame); Double.NaN if no mouse click this frame

    • getClick2D

      public Location2D getClick2D()
      Get location for the default (local) player's mouse when any button was clicked. Returns the location (a point) in screen coordinates (0.0-1.0 for both x- and y-coordinates) where any button was clicked or null if no click.
      Returns:
      the location of the mouse of the given player; null if the player did not click this frame

    • getClickX

      public double getClickX()
      Return the x-coordinate of the default (local) player's mouse when any button was clicked. If no button was clicked, will return the special numeric value not a number or Double.NaN.
      Returns:
      x-coordinate (in screens) where mouse was clicked (if clicked this frame); Double.NaN if no mouse click this frame

    • getClickY

    • addSprite

      public void addSprite(Sprite... sprite)
      Add all of the sprites (sprite can be a variable number of Sprite objects) to the game's canvas. Real work is forwarded to the AnimationCanvas class.
      Parameters:
      sprite - a list of Sprite objects to add to the top of the current scene

    • addSprite

      public void addSprite(double layer, Sprite... sprite)
      Add all of the sprites (sprite can be a variable number of Sprite objects) to the games canvas with the given z-ordering or z-level. Real work is forwarded to the AnimationCanvas class.
      Parameters:
      layer - z-order to apply to these sprites
      sprite - a list of Sprite objects to add to the given layer of the current scene

    • getLayer

      public double getLayer(Sprite sprite)
      Get the z-ordering (distance up from the background) of the given sprite.
      Parameters:
      sprite - the Sprite for which a level must be determined
      Returns:
      the z-ordering or distance from the background up to the layer containing the sprite

    • getLayer

      public Sprite[] getLayer(double layer)
      Get an array of all of the sprites in a given layer.
      Parameters:
      layer - what distance from the background are sprites to be found
      Returns:
      an array containing references to all Sprite at the given level

    • flattenLayers

      public void flattenLayers()
      Flatten all the layers into a single background layer (keeping the overall z-ordering).

    • removeSprite

      public void removeSprite(Sprite... sprite)
      Remove the given sprite or sprites ((sprite can be a variable number of Sprite objects) from the game. Real work is forwarded to the AnimationCanvas class.
      Parameters:
      sprite - a list of Sprite objects to remove from the current scene

    • removeAllSprites

      public void removeAllSprites()
      Remove all sprites from the canvas.

    • containsSprite

      public boolean containsSprite(Sprite sprite)
      Does the game contain the given sprite?
      Parameters:
      sprite - the Sprite to check for in the game
      Returns:
      true if the sprite is in the game (has been added with a call to addSprite(fang2.core.Sprite...)) or false otherwise

    • getAllSprites

      public Sprite[] getAllSprites()
      Get an array of all of the sprites in the game. This will contain all of the Sprites which have been added (through addSprite(fang2.core.Sprite...)) and not removed (through removeSprite(fang2.core.Sprite...) ).
      Returns:
      an array of all of the Sprites that are in the game

    • getColor

      public static Color getColor(int red, int green, int blue)
      Create a solid, opaque color with the given red, green, and blue values.
      Parameters:
      red - the amount of red to include; range is [0..255] with 0 meaning no red
      green - the amount of green to include; range is [0..255] with 0 meaining no green
      blue - the amount of blue to include; range is [0..255] with 0 meaning no blue
      Returns:
      a Color object for the given shade

    • getColor

      public static Color getColor(int red, int green, int blue, int opacity)
      Create a solid, translucent color with the given red, gree, and blue values. The opacity value determines how opaque the color is with 0 being completely transparent and 255 being completely opaque.
      Parameters:
      red - the amount of red to include; range is [0..255] with 0 meaning no red
      green - the amount of green to include; range is [0..255] with 0 meaning no green
      blue - the amount of blue to include; range is [0..255] with 0 meaning no blue
      opacity - the amount of opaqueness for the color; range is [0..255] with 0 meaning transparent and 255 meaning opaque
      Returns:
      a Color object for the given shade

    • getColor

      public static Color getColor(String name)
      Create a solid color with from the name given on this web page. The colors are those understood by the XWindows windowing system.
      Parameters:
      name - color name
      Returns:
      color matching name (or black with given if name is not a known color name)

    • getColor

      public static Color getColor(String name, int opacity)
      Create a semi-transparent color with from the name given on this web page.
      Parameters:
      name - color name
      opacity - the transparency for the new color (0-255)
      Returns:
      color matching name with given opacity (or black with given opacity if name is not a known color name)

    • getColorName

      public static String getColorName(int r, int g, int b)
      Get the name of the given color (specified by red, green, and blue channels.
      Parameters:
      r - red value [0..255]
      g - green value [0..255]
      b - blue value [0..255]
      Returns:
      returns the name for the color (if there is one) and returns Palette.NO_SUCH_COLOR otherwise.

    • getColorName

      public static String getColorName(String rgb)
      Get the name of given color (specified as a "#rrggbb" hex string (note that it can safely be a "#rrggbbaa" string, too.
      Parameters:
      rgb - string of the form "#rrggbb" where rr, gg, and bb are the color channel values for red, green, and blue expressed in hex
      Returns:
      returns the name for the color (if there is one) and returns Palette.NO_SUCH_COLOR otherwise.

    • getColorName

      public static String getColorName(Color color)
      Get the name of the color expressed as a Java Color object.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to name (if possible)
      Returns:
      returns the name for the color (if there is one) and returns NO_SUCH_COLOR otherwise.

    • getColorFromRGB

      public static Color getColorFromRGB(String rgb)
      Convert a "#rrggbb" string into a Java color object corresponding to the given color.
      Parameters:
      rgb - string of the form "#rrggbb" where rr, gg, and bb are the color channel values for red, green, and blue expressed in hex
      Returns:
      an opaque Color corresponding to the given rgb values.

    • getColorFromRGBA

      public static Color getColorFromRGBA(String rgba)
      Convert a "#rrggbbaa" string into a Java color object corresponding to the given color.
      Parameters:
      rgba - string of the form "#rrggbbaa" where rr, gg, and bb are the color channel values for red, green, and blue expressed in hex and aa is the alpha channel (or opacity) expressed in hex
      Returns:
      a Color corresponding to the given rgba values.

    • getColorFromRGB

      public static Color getColorFromRGB(String rgb, int opacity)
      Convert a "#rrggbb" string into a Java color object corresponding to the given color.
      Parameters:
      rgb - string of the form "#rrggbb" where rr, gg, and bb are the color channel values for red, green, and blue expressed in hex
      opacity - the opacity of the color [0..255] where 255 is opaque and 0 is transparent
      Returns:
      a Color corresponding to the given rgb and transparency values

    • addColor

      public static void addColor(String name, Color color)
      Add a color to the list of colors this Palette knows. Lets you define and use your own named colors. Color is specified as a Java Color object.
      Parameters:
      name -
      color -

    • addColor

      public static void addColor(String name, String rgb)
      Add a color to the list of colors this Palette knows. Lets you define named colors which you can later use. Color is specified as a Web string "#rrggbb" where rr, gg, and bb are hexidecimal numbers specifying color channel values for red, green, and blue.
      Parameters:
      name - the new color's name
      rgb - the new color's rgb value ("#rrggbb")

    • randomColor

      public Color randomColor()
      Returns a random color. The randome sequence is shared across multiple games in the same multi-player session.
      Returns:
      a randomly selected color.

    • getRandom

      public Random getRandom()
      Return this Game's random number generator. The random number sequence is shared across multipe games in the same multi-player session.
      Returns:
      the Random used by this game to generate random numbers.

    • randomBoolean

      public boolean randomBoolean()
      Return a randomly selected boolean value. The result is true and false half of the time each.
      Returns:
      a randomly selected boolean value.

    • randomDouble

      public double randomDouble()
      Generate a shared random double on the range [0.0, 1.0). Here "shared" means that multiple games running in the same FANG game session will see the same sequence of numbers. [0.0, 1.0) means zero is included by one is excluded from the range.
      Returns:
      random, uniformly-distributed double on the range [0.0, 1.0)

    • randomDouble

      public double randomDouble(double max)
      Generate a shared random double on the range [0.0, max). The random sequence is shared with other games in a multi-player session. The range dose not include max.
      Parameters:
      max - the top end of the range of random doubles desired
      Returns:
      random, uniformly-distributed double on the range [0.0, max).

    • randomDouble

      public double randomDouble(double min, double max)
      Generate a shared random double on the range [min, max). The random sequence is shared with other games in a multi-player session. The range includes min but excludes max.
      Parameters:
      min - the bottom end of the range of random doubles desired
      max - the top end of the range of random doubles desired
      Returns:
      random, uniformly-distributed double on [min, max).

    • randomInt

      public int randomInt()
      Generate a shared random integer on the full 32-bit range of int. The random bit sequence is shared between multiple games in the same game session.
      Returns:
      random, uniformly-distributed in on the full range of int

    • randomInt

      public int randomInt(int n)
      Generate a random number on the range [0, n). Shared random sequence between multi-player games.
      Parameters:
      n - must be positive; the number of different values desired
      Returns:
      random, uniformly-distributed int on the range [0, n)

    • randomInt

      public int randomInt(int min, int max)
      Generate a random integer on the range [min, max). Shared random sequence between multi-player games.
      Parameters:
      min - the bottom end of the range of integers desired INCLUSIVE
      max - the top end of the range of integers desired EXCLUSIVE
      Returns:
      random, uniformly-distributed int on the range [min, max)

      id - the player for whom to fetch the score

      public void setScore(int score)
      Set the score associated with the local player
      Parameters:
      score - the new score for the local player

    • getPlayerID

      public int getPlayerID()
      Get the local player's player id.
      Returns:
      the local player's id

    • hasMessage

      public boolean hasMessage(int id)
      Is there a message pending for the given player id?
      Parameters:
      id - player id to check for pending message
      Returns:
      true if there is a message pending, false otherwise

    • hasMessage

      public boolean hasMessage()
      Is there a message pending for the local player?
      Returns:
      true if there is a message pending, false otherwise

    • getMessage

      public Object getMessage(int id)
      Get the pending message for the given player. This is a blocking call.
      Parameters:
      id - player id to fetch message for
      Returns:
      an Object representing the message sent

    • getMessage

      public Object getMessage()
      Get the pending message for the local player. This is a blocking call.
      Returns:
      an Object representing the message sent

    • setup

      public void setup()
      The standard setup method. Part of the FANG videogame startup and loop. Intended to be overridden by programs implementing actual games. Default method defined to do nothing.
      Specified by:
      setup in class GameRedirection

    • advance

      public void advance()
      The standard, untimed, advance-game-state method. Part of the FANG videogame startup and loop. Intended to be overridden by games implementing real games. By default, advance() does nothing.
      Specified by:
      advance in class GameRedirection

    • advance

      public void advance(double deltaTime)
      Advance with time elapsed since previous call to advance. By default, just calls the zero parameter version of advance.
      Overrides:
      advance in class GameRedirection
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - number of seconds since last call to advance
